intro: Nephrodium glabellum, commonly known as the smooth nephroid, is a rare and distinctive plant species belonging to the family Nephroidaceae. It is characterized by its unique, kidney-shaped leaves that are smooth and glabrous, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its flowers are small and clustered, often with a subtle fragrance, and it produces distinctive seed pods that split open to release its seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Nephrodium glabellum is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
